subject: Re: [junit] How to change dynamically (runtime) the classpath for a given test
msgSnippet: ... I imagine if you ran each test in its own class loader, that d work. The easiest way I know to do that is to run the tests from Ant and use fork= yes so
messageBody:
David wrote:

> I have the following problem:
>
> I have a method that find a file on classpath and I want to test it,
> without assuming a particular classpath.
>
> My idea is to append on the classpath the System.getProperty
> ("java.io.tmpdir") location, then create a temporary file and checks
> that a given file exist on my new classpath.
>
> Changing during execution the property: java.class.path doesn't work
> because such information even the value of the property change, it's
> value is not updated on the Virtual Machine.
>
> For sure I need in some way to use some ClassLoader trick but I
> don't know how to do that.

I imagine if you ran each test in its own class loader, that'd work. The
easiest way I know to do that is to run the tests from Ant and use
fork="yes" so that each test runs in its own process. The Ant manual can
say more.
